Package ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.substringfinder

Class CharSlicer

java.lang.Object
ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.substringfinder.CharSlicer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Character>
public class CharSlicer extends Object implements Iterable<Character>
The CharSlicer class provides a fixed-size buffered sliding window over a supplied text. Creation of a slice of a length greater than the whole text length will be interrupted by an InputMismatchException. The user is supposed to destructively assign a return value of a shift(int) method to the current class instance, as it indicates if the stream is over. If the user tries to use get(int), iterator() or toCharArray() from a slice doesn't containing a specified amount of characters, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

    • CharSlicer

      public CharSlicer(InputStreamReader source, int sliceLength) throws IOException, InputMismatchException
      Constructs a new CharSlicer instance with a specified InputStreamReader and sliceLength.
      Parameters:
      source - an input stream reader
      sliceLength - a length of this slice
      Throws:
      IOException - if source is unavailable
      InputMismatchException - if source contains less than sliceLength characters
      IllegalArgumentException - if sliceLength is non-positive

  • Method Details

    • shift

      public CharSlicer shift(int amount) throws IOException
      Shifts the slice right by a specified amount of characters.
      Parameters:
      amount - an amount of characters to shift the slice by
      Returns:
      this slice if there is enough characters in the input stream, null otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is no enough characters in the input stream

    • get

      public char get(int i)
      Returns a slice character at a specified position.
      Parameters:
      i - an index of a character
      Returns:
      a character at a specified position
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if an amount of characters in this slice is less than specified due to end of stream
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not between 0 and a length of this slice (exclusive)

    • toCharArray

      public char[] toCharArray()
      Converts this CharSlicer to a new character array.
